member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Dtos.ConfigurationDtos.JobAutoDisableConfigDto.Enabled
member.summary: Whether the auto-disable feature is globally enabled. Individual jobs can override this with their own AutoDisableEnabled setting. Default: true

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Dtos.ConfigurationDtos.JobAutoDisableConfigDto.ConsecutiveFailureThreshold
member.summary: Number of consecutive failures before a job is automatically disabled. Individual jobs can override this with their own AutoDisableThreshold setting. Default: 5 consecutive failures

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Dtos.ConfigurationDtos.JobAutoDisableConfigDto.FailureWindowMinutes
member.summary: Time window in minutes for counting consecutive failures. Failures older than this window don't count towards the threshold. This prevents jobs from being disabled due to old historical failures. Default: 60 minutes (1 hour)

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Dtos.ConfigurationDtos.JobAutoDisableConfigDto.AutoReEnableAfterCooldown
member.summary: Whether to automatically re-enable jobs after a cooldown period. If true, jobs will be re-enabled after AutoReEnableCooldownMinutes. Default: false (manual re-enable required)

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Dtos.ConfigurationDtos.JobAutoDisableConfigDto.AutoReEnableCooldownMinutes
member.summary: Cooldown period in minutes before auto-disabled jobs are re-enabled. Only used if AutoReEnableAfterCooldown is true. Default: 30 minutes

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Dtos.ScheduledJobDtos.ScheduledJobDetailDto.ZombieTimeoutMinutes
member.summary: Job-specific zombie timeout in minutes. If set, occurrences stuck in Queued status longer than this will be marked as Failed. If null, global ZombieDetector timeout (10 minutes) is used. Useful for long-running jobs that need higher timeout thresholds.

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Dtos.ScheduledJobDtos.ScheduledJobDetailDto.ExecutionTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Job-specific execution timeout in seconds. If set, worker will cancel the job after this duration and mark it as TimedOut. If null, worker's JobConsumerConfig.ExecutionTimeoutSeconds is used as fallback. Default: null (use worker config, typically 3600 seconds = 1 hour).

member.summary: Display name of the scheduled job.

member.summary: Description of the scheduled job.

member.summary: Comma separated Tags of the scheduled job.

member.summary: JSON serialized payload data required for job execution.

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Features.ScheduledJobs.CreateScheduledJob.CreateScheduledJobCommand.ExecuteAt
member.summary: Scheduled execution time (UTC). Dispatcher will trigger the job at or after this time. For recurring jobs, this is automatically updated to the next execution time based on CronExpression.

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Features.ScheduledJobs.CreateScheduledJob.CreateScheduledJobCommand.CronExpression
member.summary: Cron expression for recurring job scheduling (e.g., "0 9 * * MON" for every Monday at 9 AM). Supports standard cron format (minute, hour, day of month, month, day of week). If null, the job is a one-time job that executes at ExecuteAt and is not rescheduled.

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Features.ScheduledJobs.CreateScheduledJob.CreateScheduledJobCommand.IsActive
member.summary: Indicates whether the job is active and should be processed by the dispatcher. Inactive jobs are skipped during scheduling. Users can toggle this via dashboard.

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Features.ScheduledJobs.CreateScheduledJob.CreateScheduledJobCommand.ConcurrentExecutionPolicy
member.summary: Defines behavior when a job is triggered while a previous occurrence is still running. Default: Skip - do not create new occurrence if job is already running.

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Features.ScheduledJobs.CreateScheduledJob.CreateScheduledJobCommand.WorkerId
member.summary: Target worker ID that should execute this job. If not specified, job can be executed by any compatible worker.

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Features.ScheduledJobs.CreateScheduledJob.CreateScheduledJobCommand.SelectedJobName
member.summary: Specific job type to execute on the selected worker. If WorkerId is specified, this determines which job implementation to use.

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Features.ScheduledJobs.CreateScheduledJob.CreateScheduledJobCommand.ZombieTimeoutMinutes
member.summary: Job-specific zombie timeout in minutes. If set, occurrences stuck in Queued status longer than this will be marked as Failed. If null, global ZombieDetector timeout is used. Useful for long-running jobs that need higher timeout thresholds.

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Features.ScheduledJobs.CreateScheduledJob.CreateScheduledJobCommand.ExecutionTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Job-specific execution timeout in seconds. If set, worker will cancel the job after this duration and mark it as TimedOut. If null, worker's JobConsumerConfig.ExecutionTimeoutSeconds is used as fallback. Default: null (use worker config, typically 3600 seconds = 1 hour).

member.name: P:Milvaion.Application.Features.ScheduledJobs.CreateScheduledJob.CreateScheduledJobCommand.AutoDisableSettings
member.summary: Auto-disable settings for the scheduled job.

member.name: M:Milvaion.Application.Utils.Extensions.MilvaionExtensions.DataUriRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^data:(?<mediatype>[\\w/+.-]+);base64,(?<data>[a-zA-Z0-9+/]+={0,2})$
Explanation:
Match if at the beginning of the string.
Match the string "data:".
"mediatype" capture group.
Match a character in the set [+\--/\w] atomically at least once.
Match the string ";base64,".
"data" capture group.
Match a character in the set [+/-9A-Za-z] atomically at least once.
Match '=' atomically at most 2 times.
Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

member.name: M:Milvaion.Application.Utils.Extensions.MilvaionExtensions.ReplaceAndToLowerRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
\\s+
Explanation:
Match a whitespace character atomically at least once.

member.name: M:Milvaion.Application.Utils.Extensions.MilvaionExtensions.UrlRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^(ht|f)tp(s?)\\:\\/\\/[0-9a-zA-Z]([-.\\w]*[0-9a-zA-Z])*(:(0-9)*)*(\\/?)([a-zA-Z0-9\\-\\.\\?\\,\\'\\/\\\\\\+&%\\$#_]*)?$
Explanation:
Match if at the beginning of the string.
1st capture group.
Match with 2 alternative expressions.
Match the string "ht".
Match 'f'.
Match the string "tp".
2nd capture group.
Match 's' atomically, optionally.
Match the string "://".
Match an ASCII letter or digit.
Loop greedily any number of times.
3rd capture group.
Match a character in the set [\-.\w] greedily any number of times.
Match an ASCII letter or digit.
Loop greedily any number of times.
4th capture group.
Match ':'.
Loop greedily any number of times.
5th capture group.
Match the string "0-9".
6th capture group.
Match '/' greedily, optionally.
Optional (greedy).
7th capture group.
Match a character in the set [#-'+-9?A-Z\\_a-z] atomically any number of times.
Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.
